table.name: i_transaction
table.description: The I_TRANSACTION table store all XML transactions which are received by GLog, or sent out of GLog. The I_TRANSACTION table is a child of the I_LOG_TRANSMISSION table. This table contains the one record per transaction in the XML transmissions. See table I_TRANSMISSION for the XML transmission details. Each transaction within the transmission are broken out and stored as individual records.

columns.name: I_TRANSACTION_NO
columns.description: This is a foreign key from the I_LOG table. The I_TRANSACTION_NO column specifies the transaction to which this log message pertains.

columns.name: I_TRANSMISSION_NO
columns.description: This is a foreign key to the I_TRANSMISSION table. The I_TRANSMISSION_NO column uniquely identifies the transmission.

columns.name: TRANSACTION_CODE
columns.description: TRANSACTION_CODE provides a code for the type of transaction that was transmitted. Transaction codes include: D I IU U Unknown

columns.name: WRITTEN_BY
columns.description: WRITTEN_BY contains the domain name that logged the transmission.

columns.name: STATUS
columns.description: STATUS indicates the status of the transaction. Status types include: FRESH New PROCESSED

columns.name: ELEMENT_NAME
columns.description: ELEMENT_NAME contains the name of the transaction element. These can include: ActualShipment AllocationBase Billing Invoice Item Location Rate Release RemoteQuery ShipmentStatus TenderOffer TenderResponse TransOrder Voucher Xlane

columns.name: SENDER_TRANSACTION_ID
columns.description: Specifies the Transaction Number that the sender assigned to the transaction.

columns.name: REFERENCE_TRANSACTION_ID
columns.description: Specifies an alternative Transaction Number that may be assigned by the recipient for the transaction.

columns.name: EXTERNAL_STATUS
columns.description: Specifies the external status for the Transaction.  The external status represents the result of processing at the external system.

columns.name: TRANSACTION_TYPE
columns.description: Specifies the type of information stored in the Transmission record.  For example, a record may be stored when an XML is staged via OAQ to support searching via Integration Saved Queries.

columns.name: DATA_QUERY_TYPE_GID
columns.description: Data query type of OBJECT_GID, if populated.

columns.name: XML_BLOB
columns.description: The XML_BLOB column specifies the entire XML text of the transmission.

columns.name: PARTITION_KEY
columns.description: Populated through a trigger, this key is used to determine into which partition this record should be inserted.  The formula is based upon the insert_date column and the frequency in which this table is associated (weekly, monthly, quarterly).  Valid values are 1-4.
